column2: lallaland, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My dermatologist prescribed Enbrel for my granuloma annulare and within 1 month the lesions decreased in size--In 3 months they were almost gone.  Had to stop treatment due to the cost of the medication.

column2: steve h, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: before i started taking enbrel, i could hardly function. i have reactive arthritis and enbrel is a lifesaver. if i don't take it on time it's hard for me to move or get out of bed.

column2: campdog, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column9: Hair is coming out everyday for the last 4 wks. And have used it for 6 wks.

column2: Katrina, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: after severe erythedermic and guttate psoriasis flare up started on 25mg twice weekly then up to 50mg twice weekly,and back to 2x25 mg Took 6weeks to see gradual difference but certainly made skin more manageable even with some persistent patches.Would get severe sinus type headaches varying in frequency as side effect.I could not tolerate side effects of other drugs like methotrexate.I need someone to give me the injections but am told in America pen type is available but not yet in UK ,this might be easier to use.I have been using Etanercept(Embrel)for 15 months and would recommend it

column2: darrelmosher, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
rlazys@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My medicare advantage health insurance doesn't cover injectibles, anything oral instead?

column2: Toni, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After trying numerous medications for psoriasis and arthritis this was my last hope. My hands were in the worst condition. Unable to move or even open hands up was very painful. After starting this med my condition cleared within a month, am able to use my hands again.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This medication comes in a kit which can be difficult to assemble considering my condition. The effectiveness of this med has certainly made a huge difference in my quality of life. I was told it may take some time to notice any changes but I felt remarkably better within 4 hours of first injection. I have been very pleased with my results. Side effects have been minimal for me. Limited mainly to injection site reactions.
